name: Hilton Vienna

reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from a short stay in Vienna. We stayed at the Hilton Vienna on Am Stadtpark. We found it to be an excellent hotel. The beds were very comfortable. We found an excellent rate on the Hilton website that also included the excellent buffet breakfast. You could even get fresh made waffles for breakfast. The location was good as well. Very close to the CAT from the airport. The underground was right across the street. The hotel was very clean. The rooms were a good size as was the bathroom. Lots of hot water. It is very easy to find when exiting the CAT station. When exiting just turn right then turn right at the corner. Go one block and turn right, the road looks like it is under construction. The Hilton is about 1.5 blocks down the road on the left. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a beautiful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at this hotel when it was new in the 1980's, then shortly before its renovation in 2002, I am pleased that it is now back to the modern Hilton standards. The standard rooms are not particularly spacious, but the corner units are roomy and much airier, thanks to much bigger windows. Most rooms have a good unobstructed view.
reviews.title: good hotel in convenient location

reviews.text: This hotel has a convenient transportation links to all of Vienna on its doorstep.
reviews.title: Excellent quality service

reviews.text: Room prices appear to vary widely depending on seasons and events at the nearby conference center.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with premium service and outstanding location

reviews.text: A stylish, modern hotel with easy access to the main sights. In common with most decent hotels in large European capital cities it was rather expensive and the rooms were rather small but the quality of service was exceptional.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at Hilton Vienna for one night in executive room.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but!!!!
Stay well away, there is no guarantee there will be a room for you here when you arrive
reviews.text: The room was good,little small,but i ask for a double bed and i get two single beds stack.
The breakfast was good but for the price you have to pay i thing it is very poor.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, great breakfast (healthy)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in much better Hilton hotels and i think that you can find in this money a better hotel in Vienna.
reviews.title: One of best choices in Vienna

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through my American Express business travel agent and as a HHonours member I thought I knew what to expect. However, I turned up after an awful, delayed flight only to be turned away at the front desk. Apparently they had "double booked" and my room was no longer available, in fact they had no rooms available at all.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY CHOICE

reviews.text: I stayed there for 1 night 19-20.04.2010 Reception service was not very friendly when i came in. In room i liked bed and sheets, room ans bathroom was small bot cozy, with good view, but really disturbing me i guess too thin wall, i could hear TV in naber room and what about they were talking about. Very good room service, quick and delicious. And consierge was helpful.
reviews.title: thin walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights over Easter and could find no faults at all. All of the staff from reception, concierge and Exec Lounge were all friendly and attentive. Really enjoyed the Exec lounge which provided a very good range of drinks and snacks. Try the Austrian wines which were very good. The hotel rooms are very comfortable, clean and conservative with ample space in my Exec room. The hotel is also situated right next door to the CAT express train which will bring you directly from the Airport for 10 Euro. A metro station is also next to the hotel should you not wish to walk to the centre of Vienna which is about 5 to 10 minutes away and a very pleasant walk. All in all great service and i will defintely stay here on my next trip to beautiful Vienna
reviews.title: Great Great Service

reviews.text: The Hilton in Vienna is really a great hotel - perfect service, great location, very nice atmosphere. I was there for business, travelling with a colleague and we had a nic relaxing time in the hotel after our business meetings.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in a very nice city

reviews.text: The rooms are big, clean and very friendly. For me it was a little too warm in the room during the night and it was difficult to get it cooler... but the rest was great and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Vienna

reviews.text: The breakfast was amazing - you get really everything you want! It was very noisy in the restaurant as there have been a lot of asian people having breakfast in that moment, but anyway you can always find a nice and quieter place. I liked it very much that they explain what kind of breakfast you can have and show you with colours what you should eat if you need energy, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: If you want some good drinks plus some entertainment from a bartender who could put Tom Cruise in "Cocktail" to shame, head to the lobby bar. Friendly ambiance. Great place to stop for a pre-dinnerevening cocktail or a nightcap.
reviews.title: Hotel was fine...but don't miss the lobby bar

reviews.text: We had a great experience during our stay for a week at the Hilton Vienna! It is very clean and modern and the hotel staff is very polite & attentive, making sure we had everything we needed. The beds are very firm though, so if you prefer a softer bed ask for extra comforters and pillows. The hotel is about a 15 min walk to Karntnerstrasse (city center promenade) and a 10 min walk to the Danube River. I heard from others that it is much nicer than the nearby Intercontinental Hotel. We would stay there again, but might first check out some other hotels for a location closer to the Danube or city center.
reviews.title: Beautiful Contemporary Hotel 15 Min Walk to City Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (+) Location, Rooms, Breakfast, Upkeeping, TV, Quiet corridors, Air conditioning
reviews.title: Good but not excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: (-) Expensive internet, Small bathrooms, Upgrading doesn't pay*, Unfair promisses fulfilling**
reviews.title: excellent in all areas

reviews.text: * just higher floor without view
reviews.title: Good for small conference and personaly nicely placed

description: Stylishly designed, Hilton Vienna is Austria’s biggest hotel. The hotel is situated in the heart of the city, providing a direct link to Vienna International Airport via the adjacent City Airport Train Terminal. The excellent location makes your stay in Vienna a pleasure, both for business or leisure travellers. Many famous sightseeing attractions and the most fashionable shopping streets are only a few minutes’ walk away. The biggest conference hotel in Austria offers meeting facilities for up to 840 participants. Enjoy innovative cuisine in the S’PARKS Restaurant, sample traditional Viennese pastries in the Lobby Bar & Lounge and relax or work out in our fully-equipped fitness centre with sauna and steam bath.Guests enjoy complimentary WiFi access in all public areas of the hotel.In 2013 Hilton Vienna has again received the prestigious certificate of the Austrian Eco label.
